poem:
**The Last Line**

In Sharrington, under skies as broad as dreams,  
Derek fights for iron bones and glassy seams,  
A red sentinel against time's fierce demand,  
Where whispers of the past still stand.  
Coins clink with ghosts, their stories spun,  
A village heart, proud, half-forgot, half-won.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
